I was joined by @RepDougCollins, Ranking Member of @JudiciaryGOP, in introducing H.R. 3533, the Combat Violent Crime Act, to update current US code & allow for more effective prosecution of individuals who commit violent crimes. More: https://roby.house.gov/newsroom/press-releases/roby-collins-introduce-legislation-more-effectively-prosecute-violent …

On Mon., SCOTUS struck down a portion of US criminal code related to crimes committed w/ firearms, ruling the statute unconstitutionally vague. In his opinion, Justice Gorsuch stated Congress could update/clarify the language. Today we took a step towards accomplishing that goal.

The goal of their proposal is to increase the number of trafficking reports while reducing the number of victims of these heinous crimes. I appreciate their eagerness to tackle such a critical issue impacting communities across the country.

The existing facilities at Dannelly that currently service the F-16 Red Tail’s squadron are inadequate, & I look forward to working w/ my colleagues on this issue as we continue through the FY2020 appropriations process. https://roby.house.gov/newsroom/press-releases/roby-house-floor-dannelly-field-facility-updates-necessary-support-f-35 …

The 187th Fighter Wing at Dannelly Field in Montgomery was selected as a preferred location for the bed down of the F-35. The 1st aircraft will arrive in the next few yrs, & Dannelly needs a correctly sized, properly configured maintenance facility to support & repair it.

Yesterday, I spoke on the House floor during consideration of the Military Construction & Veterans Affairs Appropriations Subcommittee FY2020 funding bill to raise awareness for the facility updates needed at Dannelly Field to support the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter mission. pic.twitter.com/kEkQxue6LS

ICYMI: This week, I offered a #ProLife amendment to a funding bill that would prevent taxpayer $ from being spent on abortion in D.C. Taxpayer $ should never be used for the destruction of human life, especially in our nation's capital. My amendment helps guard the innocent. https://twitter.com/yhn/status/1139142676924850176 …

DC currently permits abortion during all 9 months of pregnancy for any reason. I can’t begin to express my concern w/ this. My amendment upholds the basic duties of government & helps guard the innocent in our nation's capital. Read more here: https://roby.house.gov/newsroom/press-releases/roby-offers-amendment-defend-unborn-nation-s-capital …

Yesterday, during full Appropriations Committee markup of the Financial Services & General Govt Appropriations Subcommittee FY2020 funding bill, I offered a #ProLife amendment, known as the Dornan Amendment, that would prevent taxpayer funds from being spent on abortion in DC. pic.twitter.com/MjrdpXh5LJ

For too long our country has been complicit, thru our tax dollars, in experimentation using babies' bodies. There are other scientifically-proven ways to conduct research, & we can do better. This is a significant #ProLife victory - I thank @POTUS for taking this decisive action.

Major pro-life win: Last week, @HHSGov & @NIH announced they will not renew a contract w/ the University of California, San Francisco to fund research using the body parts of aborted babies. https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2019/06/05/statement-from-the-department-of-health-and-human-services.html …

ICYMI: Last night, the House passed a disaster relief bill that includes aid for Wiregrass communities that were devastated by Hurricane Michael. The bill now awaits POTUS' signature. Grateful to finally send help to those who need it most, especially our farmers. via @yhn https://twitter.com/yhn/status/1135960749396897792 …

Each student who participates in my D.C. internship program works w/ their peers to draft & present a policy proposal on a topic of their choice. These students selected an important issue, & I'm proud of their work. More info about the internship program: https://roby.house.gov/student-resources/internships …

Earlier today, Alex, Annabel, & Greyson, the students in my D.C. office's 1st internship session, presented their policy proposal. I am eager to see the President sign this bill into law to finally help the many Americans who have suffered extreme devastation in the wake of natural disasters across the country.

Next stop: The White House. For 8 long months, farmers in the Wiregrass & throughout the SE have waited for disaster relief aid after Hurricane Michael devastated the region last October. I am very proud that Congress has at last delivered this long-overdue assistance. https://twitter.com/RepCloakroom/status/1135683325769785344 …
